alert.note: Alert for Butler (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Butler, Crenshaw, Monroe and Wilcox. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Camden, Vredenburgh, Yellow Bluff, Pine Apple, Petrey, Highland Home, Mount Moriah, Monterey, Awin, Ridgeville, Forest Home, Furman, Butler Springs, Saucer, Allenton, Snow Hill, McBrydes, Herbert and Old Texas.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
